smart_air Name First Name Last Name "User Name" Email Password Register "SIGN IN" "Forget Password?" "DON'T HAVE AN ACCOUNT?" "LOGIN" "SIGN IN WITH YOUR USERNAME (CHILD)" "Are you able to talk without taking breaks to breathe?" "Does it feel like you have to work hard to breathe in?" "Have you noticed any changes in the colour of your lips or eyebrows?" "What is your current PEF? (Optional)" "Have you taken rescue medication today?" "Your action plan will appear here" "CALL EMERGENCY SERVICES" "How long ago? (e.g., 5 mins)" "Red Flag Symptoms" Please enter your current PEF to see your action plan. Your PEF Personal Best is not set. Cannot determine action plan. Green Zone: Your asthma is well-controlled. Continue your current medication plan. Yellow Zone: Your asthma is worsening. Take 2 to 4 puffs of your rescue inhaler immediately. Red Zone: Medical alert! Take 4 to 6 puffs of your rescue inhaler immediately. This is guidance, not a diagnosis. If in doubt, call emergency. Enter "Birthday (YYYY-MM-DD)" "LINK THIS CHILD" "Technique Step 1 Animation" "Technique Step 2 Empty Animation" "Technique Step 2 Not Empty Animation" "Technique Step 3 Empty Animation" "Technique Step 3 Not Empty Animation" "Technique Step 4 Animation" "Technique Step 5 Animation" "Technique Step 6 Animation" "Technique Step 7 Animation" "Technique Step Rest Animation" "Check the dose counter on the inhaler, do not use if it says zero.
 Zero means the inhaler is empty and needs to be replaced." "I got a new inhaler, let's start!" "The inhaler isn't empty, let's start!" "Prime the brand new inhaler by shaking for 10 seconds." "I did it!" "Spray 2 or 4 puffs into the air based on your medicine instructions." "Prime the inhaler by shaking for 10 seconds." "Take the cap off the inhaler.
 Make sure the mouthpiece and valved holding chamber are clean." "Place the mouthpiece into the open end of the valved holding chamber.
 Remove the valved holding chamber mouthpiece cap.
 Prepare your body by sitting or standing up straight.
" "Breathe out all the way from the holding chamber.
 Put the mouthpiece into your mouth above your tongue.
 Close your lips tightly around the mouthpiece" "Press down the top of the inhaler once to release the medicine.
 Breathe in for 3 to 5 seconds using one deep and steady breath to pull the medicine into your lungs.
 If the holding chamber whistles, you are breathing in too fast!" "Remove the chamber from your mouth.
 Hold your breath for up to 10 seconds.
 Then breathe out slowly through your mouth.
" "If you need another puff, wait with the cat for 1 minute, then proceed with the 'Another Puff' button.
 Or you can proceed with 'Finish Taking Medicine'." "Another Puff" "Finish Taking Medicine" Technique Streak Flame Controller Streak Flame Empty Streak Icon "Consecutive Technique-Session Completed: %1$d" Consecutive Controller Days Completed: %1$d

Triage Timeline — How to Read This Chart:
 • Each dot represents a triage-related event.
 • The horizontal axis shows when the event happened.
 • The vertical axis shows the PEF Zone (if applicable) or Emergency
 (N/A → Green → Yellow → Red → Emergency).
 • Larger dots indicate red-flag symptoms.
 where black dots mean PEF = N/A • Emergency events appear at the top in dark red.
 • You can zoom or drag to explore the timeline.
